output_list.reason: The mintToken function allows an attacker to mint an arbitrary amount of tokens owned by the attacker, due to a lack of overflow checks.
The mintToken function allows the owner to mint tokens at will, devaluing the token and causing financial loss to token holders.
The transferFrom function allows a user to transfer tokens to any address, without any checks, leading to unauthorized token transfers.
The claimThrone function has an integer overflow vulnerability in the refund calculation, allowing attackers to exploit it and steal funds.
The ToOwner function has unprotected constructor, allowing any user to claim ownership and steal funds.
